recipes: To Exalt a Disciple to an Assassin, I will need Edge to at least the twenty-first intensity. In any case, only the most savage will be suitable.
To Exalt a Disciple to a Reshaper, I will need Forge to at least the twenty-first intensity. In any case, only the most ingenious and effective will be suitable.
To Exalt a Disciple to a Cyprian, I will need Grail to at least the twenty-first intensity. In any case, only those with the most inconsolable appetites will be suitable.
To Exalt a Disciple to a Tarantellist, I will need Heart to at least the twenty-first intensity. In any case, only the most spirited will be suitable.
To Exalt a Disciple to a Key, I will need Knock to at least the twenty-first intensity.  In any case, only the most gifted will be suitable.
To Exalt a Disciple to a Seer, I will need Lantern to at least the twenty-first intensity.  In any case, only the most clear-sighted will be suitable.
To Exalt a Disciple to a Skintwister, I will need Moth to at least the twenty-first intensity.  In any case, only very rare individuals will be suitable.
To Exalt a Disciple to a degree that has no name, I will need Winter to at least the twenty-first intensity.  In any case, only the bleakest souls will be suitable.
To promote a Believer to a Disciple, I'll need to provide an appropriate aspect for the cult, to at least the seventh intensity.
Perhaps some day it might be possible to recruit this redoubtable individual. But I would need something extraordinary to convince them.
This one might join me... if I can muster the Aspect of our cult, to the twenty-first degree. [You can recruit a Troublemaker, even one of a different persuasion, if you can provide enough power].
To recruit a follower, I will need a little of the power we revere. I might glean it from an Influence, or a Tool, or an Ingredient, or just the Lore of our tradition.
